enWisdom: The jealous person is always ill

Wisdom: الْحَسُودُ لَا خُلَّةَ لَهُ [لَا خِلَالَ لَهُ‏]
enWisdom: For the jealous one, there is no friendship
The jealous one has no friendship
The jealous one has many regrets and his sins are multiplied

Wisdom: الْحَسُودُ وَالْحَقُودُ لَا تَدُومُ لَهُمَا مَسَرَّةٌ
enWisdom: Happiness does not last for the jealous and the spiteful
The jealous person will never be found happy
Jealousy is one of the two torments

Wisdom: الْحَسَدُ يَأْكُلُ الْحَسَنَاتِ كَمَا تَأْكُلُ النَّارُ الْحَطَبَ
enWisdom: Jealousy eats away good deeds just like fire consumes firewood

Wisdom: الْحَسُودُ دَائِمُ السُّقْمِ وَإِنْ كَانَ صَحِيحَ الْجِسْمِ
enWisdom: The jealous one is always sick, even when his body is healthy
Be cautious of jealousy, for it disparages the self
The fruit of jealousy is wretchedness in this world and the Hereafter

Wisdom: وَيْحَ الْحَسَدِ مَا أَعْدَلَهُ بَدَأَ بِصَاحِبِهِ فَقَتَلَهُ
enWisdom: Woe be to jealousy, how fair it is! It starts off with its companion and then kills him
